messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] please explain???
messages.msgSnippet: I know this is probably going to sound very silly, but could someone please tell me what the D stands for; as in Dh  Dd and Ds. I assume it is Dear husband,
messages.messageBody:
I know this is probably going to sound very silly, but
could someone please tell me what the D stands for; as
in Dh Dd and Ds. I assume it is Dear husband,
daughter, son, but I am not sure! :-)

**It's a fill in the blank...whatever your mood. Think of how many
adjectives begin with "d".

Valerie in Tacoma

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] please explain???
messages.msgSnippet: Oh Kim!!!  I had the same problem, and no one would answer my question for the longest time!!!! Anyway, you re right.  It is Dear Husband, Dear Daughter, Dear
messages.messageBody:
Oh Kim!!! I had the same problem, and no one would answer my question for
the longest time!!!!

Anyway, you're right. It is Dear Husband, Dear Daughter, Dear Son!!


----Original Message Follows----
From: Kim Baker <azhom2000@...>
Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] please explain???
Date: Sat, 10 Mar 2001 23:04:43 -0800 (PST)

I know this is probably going to sound very silly, but
could someone please tell me what the D stands for; as
in Dh Dd and Ds. I assume it is Dear husband,
daughter, son, but I am not sure! :-)

=====
Kim - Missouri MOM of Dylan(10) Jacob(10) Noah(20 mos)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] please explain???
messages.msgSnippet: Normally yes, but it can depend on the said husband / daughter / son s recent behaviour  ;-) Carol
messages.messageBody:
Normally yes, but it can depend on the said husband / daughter / son's recent
behaviour ;-)

Carol
